36.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

36.parse: Verb - Present Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
36.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

37.str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A Nazarene, an inhabitant of Nazareth. From Nazareth; a Nazoraean, i.e. Inhabitant of Nazareth; by extension, a Christian.

37.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
37.str2: From para and erchomai; to come near or aside, i.e. To approach, go by, perish or neglect, avert.

37.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
37.str2: To report (from one place to another), bring a report, announce, declare. From apo and the base of aggelos; to announce.

37.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
37.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

38.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: To shout, call aloud, proclaim. Apparently a prolonged form of a primary verb; to halloo, i.e. Shout.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.

38.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
38.str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.

38.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

39.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

39.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
39.str2: From pro and ago; to lead forward; intransitively, to precede (participle, previous).

39.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
39.str2: From epi and timao; to tax upon, i.e. Censure or admonish; by implication, forbid.

39.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
39.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
39.str2: Intrans: I am silent, keep silence; trans: I keep secret; pass: I am kept secret. From sige; to keep silent.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

39.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
39.str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
39.str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.

39.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

40.str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

40.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
40.str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

40.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
40.str2: To command, order, direct, bid. From a primary kello; 'hail'; to incite by word, i.e. Order.

40.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
40.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

40.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
40.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

40.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
40.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

40.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
40.str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.

40.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
40.str2: To interrogate, question, demand of. From epi and erotao; to ask for, i.e. Inquire, seek.

40.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

41.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

41.str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

41.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

41.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

41.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

41.str2: To look up, recover my sight. From ana and blepo; to look up; by implication, to recover sight.

42.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

42.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

43.str2: To look up, recover my sight. From ana and blepo; to look up; by implication, to recover sight.

43.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
43.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

43.str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

43.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
